applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to this document for several reasons: 1) The document is a comprehensive set of scheme rules for an executive pension life cover product that clearly and accurately describes its nature and benefits throughout. The name 'Executive Pension Life Cover Scheme' accurately reflects that it is a death benefit scheme providing coverage for executives/employees through their employer. 2) The document explicitly states its main purpose in Section 1 under 'The Scheme' definition: 'The main and only purpose of the scheme is to provide benefits for the member's dependants if the member dies before normal retirement age.' This aligns perfectly with the product name. 3) The document provides detailed explanations of all benefits, limitations, and conditions in clear language, with no evidence of misleading naming or marketing. 4) The product name accurately conveys that it is a pension-related life cover scheme, which matches exactly what the product delivers according to the detailed rules provided. Therefore, there is no violation of the regulation regarding misleading naming of financial services.
regulation_title: Names of financial services not to be misleading with regard to nature or benefits
regulation_text: 44. A regulated entity shall not use a name for a financial service that is misleading in terms of the nature of the financial service or the benefits that the financial service can deliver to a consumer.
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
